title: doc: document pprof --alloc_objects/--alloc_bytes
body:
I forgot how memprofile worked and wanted to profile all allocations. Russ reminded me
for the third time:

"memprofile dumps a profile of the memory at the end of the test. It's for seeing
where memory goes statically. If you want to see the complete allocation history you can
run the test with GOGC=off. Or you can use a cpuprofile - usually the garbage
collections end up where the most common allocations are."

Carl said he wants profiling support for all allocations as well.

Filing this for later.
